item.description:
The 3rd Annual HIFF is sponsoring the movie "The Exiles" at the Wadsworth Atheneum Museum Aetna Theatre. "The Exiles" was filmed between 1958 and 1961. It shows the lives of Native Americans who left the reservation and moved to Bunker Hill, a neighborhood in Los Angeles. Fully restored in 2008, it was named one of the 100 Best American Films by the Library of Congress in 2006.

The 3rd Annual Hartford International Film Festival is running the weekend of Nov. 6-9, 2008. 32 films are shown at 8 area theaters, including some theatres that you never heard of like, The Art Cinema, located on Franklin Avenue in Hartford, this Art Deco theatre was built in the 1940's. The Art Cinema is showing experimental films on Sat. morning and evening from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm and from 11:00 pm to 1:00 am.

Or the Hartford Children's Theater. This small intimate theatre on Farmington Avenue will be showing CT made films on Sunday, Nov. 9, 2008 in the afternoon between 11:00 am to 3:30 pm.

Visit the website for the schedule and ticket info.
